medical_history.chief_complaint: A 16-year-old boy presented with a 3-cm swelling in his left upper arm after a 2-week course of flucloxacillin, adjacent to a 12-month-old Bacillus Calmette-Gu√©rin vaccination scar.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The lesion developed 12 months after vaccination and was adjacent to the vaccination site. There were no signs of inflammation, consistent with a cold abscess.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a previous excision of squamous cell carcinoma from his forearm and had undergone a skin graft that utilized staples for stabilization.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was asymptomatic with no significant medical history reported other than the previous squamous cell carcinoma and excision.
